text: Hey everyone, does anybody know what needs to be done to get the functionality of the default HS modules (Visibility & Alignment and Spacing) to work on a Custom Module. I made a module, but toggling between "Edit for Desktop" and "Edit for Mobile" has no effect on the styles.
You can use CSS for this, with @media queries

```/* The media query ensures that on mobile the image 
will always appear above the text for 
visual consistency. */```
Is there a way to reference the set media breakpoint (defined in theme.json)
yeah you definitely can if you're using dnd tags

Thanks <@U01QVR44MEY> I think I understand that from a dnd section perspective. But I'm confused as to what gives a custom module the ability to store, for example, margins for desktop and mobile? When I make a custom module toggling those tabs has no effect. Any margins in place on the desktop setting just remain when toggling to the mobile tab. And vice versa.
